expressed a hope for the presenter to finally topple Jay Leno 's long-time lead. "I want to see you beat Jay Leno in the ratings tonight," he said. The DJ then joked: Look, I love you, I'm in your corner. I don't want the same thing to happen to you that happened to Regis[ Philbin]. The rivalry between the two late-night hosts stems from NBC's decision to hire Jay Leno to replace Johnny Carson on The Tonight Show in 1992, passing over David Letterman in the process. From a defensive standpoint, you've got to keep him from monopolising the game. He's a great player. He can create, improvise with his feet, go to his second and third choice in the route because he has such a quick release. Ben Roethlisberger isn't as speedy as Aaron Rodgers or Michael Vick nor as statuesque as Tom Brady and Peyton Manning ; he just makes it work.
